intro: Onobroma depauperatum, commonly known as the poorflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Onobroma depauperatum is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
